sect3.title: Overview

figure.title: Example for Mark Out of Gamut

caption.para: Image with Mark Out Of Gamut and Soft Proof enabled in the view menu, and the image's soft-proofing profile set to PSO Uncoated v3 (a CMYK profile).

sect3.para: When enabled, Mark Out Of Gamut Colors will mark all pixels that are out of gamut in the current display of your image with a specific color that you can set in the Soft-Proofing Preferences that can be found in the Color Management section.
This allows you to see which parts of your image will not display correctly on your target device (often a printer).

To get an idea how your image will look enable
View Color Management Proof Colors .

sect3.title: Activating the Command
sect3.para:
You can access this command from the main menu through
View Color Management Mark Out Of Gamut Colors .
